laboratory_examinations.findings: Three large hyperechogenic masses (3 35 mm) causing severe tricuspid valve stenosis.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: At discharge, echocardiogram showed growth of tricuspid valve masses with moderate stenosis and mild insufficiency.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Successful repair with only mild valvular insufficiency.
Connective-sclerotic nodules with nuclei of calcification-ossification and absence of tumor cells.
Amorphous, calcified, slightly basophilic mass, with areas of mineralization and nuclei of calcification.
Positive for desmin and smooth-muscle actin.
